data.title: Famous People From Yokohama, Japan & Celebs Born In Yokohama
data.meta_description: Yokohama has produced a number of famous personalities, including actors, voice actors, essayists, football players etc.
data.text:
1

Antonio Inoki

(Japanese Retired Professional Wrestler and Founder of 'New Japan Pro-Wrestling')

11

4

Listed In: Sportspersons

Birthdate: November 20, 1943

Sun Sign: Scorpio

Died: October 1, 2022

Once a reputed Japanese martial artist and wrestler, Antonio Inoki grew up in Brazil, where he won several contests of shot put, discus, and javelin. At 17, he went to the Japanese Wrestling Association and was mentored by Rikidōzan. He later established the New Japan Pro Wrestling.

2

3

Masaru Emoto

(Essayist, Writer)

4

1

Listed In: Writers

Birthdate: July 22, 1943

Sun Sign: Cancer

Died: October 17, 2014

Masaru Emoto was a Japanese author, businessman, and pseudo-scientist. He is best remembered for his New York Times bestseller book The Hidden Messages in Water in which he claimed that thought can influence the molecular structure of water. He also served as the president emeritus of a non-profit organization called International Water For Life Foundation.

Recommended Lists:

4

Takehito Koyasu

(Seiyū, Singer)

4

3

Listed In: Film & Theater Personalities

Birthdate: May 5, 1967

Sun Sign: Taurus

One of Japan’s most diverse voice actors, Takehito Koyasu has voiced over 230 different roles. He has also been part of the voice-acting group Weiss and has dubbed for many foreign actors such as Freddie Prinze Jr. and Jared Leto in live-action films. His son Kōki Koyasu, too, is a voice actor

Recommended Lists:

5

Tadanobu Asano

(Japanese Actor Known for His Films: 'Electric Dragon 80.000 V', 'Ichi the Killer' and 'Battleship')

5

5

Listed In: Film & Theater Personalities

Birthdate: November 27, 1973

Sun Sign: Sagittarius

Japanese actor Tadanobu Satō, better known as Tadanobu Asano, had begun his acting career at 16, with the show Kimpachi Sensei, at his father’s insistence. He later gained critical acclaim with roles in films such as Maborosi and Fried Dragon Fish. He has also sung for the band Mach 1.67.

Crystal Kay

(Japanese Pop Singer Known for Her Prolific Singing Career)

1

1

Listed In: Singers

Birthdate: February 26, 1986

Sun Sign: Pisces

Crystal Kay is a Japanese singer, actress, songwriter, and radio host. Crystal is best known for her album Almost Seventeen which has sold more than 400,000 copies, earning her platinum certificate from the Recording Industry Association of Japan (RIAJ). She is also known for her collaborations with popular recording artists like Chemistry and BoA.

Phyllis A. Whitney

(American Novelist)

3

0

Listed In: Writers

Birthdate: September 9, 1903

Sun Sign: Virgo

Died: February 8, 2008

Phyllis Ayame Whitney was an American writer best remembered for writing mystery novels. Dubbed the Queen of the American Gothics, Whitney won an Edgar Award for her book The Mystery of the Haunted Pool in 1961. In 1988, she was honored with the Grand Master Award by the Mystery Writers of America for her overall contribution.

Keiiti Aki

(Japanese-American Professor, Mentor, Author, and Seismologist)

1

1

Listed In: Miscellaneous

Birthdate: March 3, 1930

Sun Sign: Pisces

Died: May 17, 2005

Keiiti Aki was a Japanese-American professor, mentor, author, and seismologist. He is best remembered for teaching Geophysics at the University of Southern California and at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. Over the course of his career, Keiiti Aki received several prestigious awards, including the William Bowie Medal and the Thorarinsson Medal.
